731621f-c.title: Feast of Our Lady of Mount Carmel, No. 10-12.
731621f-c.text:
(1)
Feast of Our Lady of Mt. Carmel: Parade going west on 114th
Street past Jefferson Park, east of First Avenue, showing the
banner of the Little Brothers of Our Lady of Mt. Carmel, s
religious society, with offerings of paper currency pinned
to it.
July 16, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
V1  (.2gf N~S.614S  E  t 1 I
(2)
Parade, entering First Avenue from 105th Street (the view is
west) showing two elaborate candelabra, borne by women on
their heads.
July 16, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
Parade, in an unidentified street, showing candelabra in
same detail.
July lo, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.

707712f-a.title: Manhattan: 1st Ave. - 114th St.
707712f-a.text:
2224 First Avenue, adjoining N. E. corner of 114th Street. This
house will stand in 1934.
1932.
J. Clarence Davies Collection, Museum of the City of New York.
Negative No. 130.

720692f-a.title: Manhattan: 1st Avenue - 114th Street
720692f-a.text:
Jefferson Park: A view showing children wading in a shallow
pool on the north side of the Park that lies east of First Ave. The
photograpdher is viewing northwestward to show buildings on East 114th
Street. The 5 story structure with a cross mounted atop same is given
as a M.E. Church (no name) by Bromley's Atlas of 1922. It is in this
vicinity that the street carnivals for the Feast of Our Lady of Mt.
Carmel are held; the Church being around the corner on East 115th Street.
July 1933.
George L. Balgue.
A photograph showing the bandstand that is located in the east-
1y portion of the Park. Subsecuently the East River Drive will
be constructed at the left.

720692f-b.text:

May 23, 1934.

720691f-c.title: Manhattan: 114th Street (East) - 1st Avenue
720691f-c.text:
JJefferson Park- Three views in a southwestward direction
progressively from East 114th Street, showing the new swimming
pool and hard-ball courts.
Buildings aid gas nolders in the background are on the
west side of First Avenue, at Eastlllth Street. The park is
on the east side of the Avenue and extenes from 1l1th to 114th
Streets.
138
Views: 1-2-3
Gift of Committee on Housing
Charity Orga ization Society

715079f-a.title: Manhattan: 114th Street (East) - 1st Avenue
715079f-a.text:
346 Esast 114th Street, south side, west of First Avenue.
This is a one-story frame shack at the south end of a vacant lot,
left by demolition of a three-story frame house. In the back-
ground is a three-story frame house at the rear of 343 East 113th
Street.
1932.
J. Clarence Davies Collection, Museum of the City of New York,
Negative No. 248

731660f-a.title: Feast of Our Lady of Mount Carmel.
731660f-a.text:
(1)
Feast of Our Lady of Mt. Carmel, No. 10: Elderly women and
mothers marching in the procession.
July 16, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
No. 11
A girl selling ballons to the paraders when they pass her
fathers general merchandise stand, on First Ave., at East 111th Street;
a unit of a local retail neighborhood market.
July 16, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
No. 12:
A lad selling soda to the marchers and spectators on East 114th
Street at First Ave.
July 16, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.

731662f-b.title: Feast of Our Lady of Mount Carmel.

731662f-c.title: Feast of Our Lady of Mount Carmel.

731662f-a.title: Feast of Our Lady of Mount Carmel.

731619f-b.title: Feast of Our Lady of Mount Carmel.
731619f-b.text:
(1)
Feast of Our Lady of Mt. Carmel: Parade, marching south on First
Avenue past the filling station adjoining the S.w. corner of
109th Street. A woman in the centen of the picture is carry-
ing wax votive images of a head and an abdomen. These will
be carried into the church and laid at Our Lady's altar.
The filling station in the background was built since 1925,
replacing three old frame sheds. The angle made by the build-
ing on the left is due to the property line, which at this
point coincided with the S.W. side of Roosevelt Road, a country
road long since obliterated.
July 16, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.  Neg RR0S
(2)
Parade, entering and turning south on First Aveme at 115th
Street.
Jefferson Park lies on the east side of First Avenue from
114th to 111th Streets.
July 16, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.  i DE2:
V11S  ( 2H EE1: M  .  E
(3)
Parade, moving east on 114th Street opposite N.W. corner of
First Avenue. The girl in the foreground is carrying a giant
oandle on her head.
July 16, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
i EE 25  iP  -44-  ) 7  (S4 4( :47  1uS  1177

out-door booth, First Avenue, east side, Jefferson Fark.

(3)
Cheese vendor with truck, 114th Street, north side, between
First and Pleasant Avenues.

731614f-b.title: Feast of Our Lady of Mount Carmel.
731614f-b.text:
(1)
Feast of Our Lady of Mt. Carmel: Vendors of toy balloons, at
First Avenue and 114th Street. The view is north.
The woman is wearing a "Eelen Wills" eyeshade; these were very
much in fashion the preceding year.
July 16, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
A man and his son buying votive candles. Notice that refreshments
are also for sale here.
July 16, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.
